definition: most important element, an original creation (i.e., an audio recording) from which copies can be made, have a firm understanding or knowledge of
details:
adjective
- most important element
= synonyms: main
noun
- an original creation (i.e., an audio recording) from which copies can be made
= synonyms: original
- key that secures entrance everywhere
= synonyms: passe-partout, passkey, master key
- presiding officer of a school
= synonyms: schoolmaster
- an artist of consummate skill
= example: an artist of consummate skill
= synonyms: maestro
- an authority qualified to teach apprentices
= synonyms: professional
- directs the work of others
- someone who holds a master's degree from academic institution
- an officer who is licensed to command a merchant ship
= synonyms: captain, skipper, sea captain
- a person who has general authority over others
= synonyms: overlord, lord
- a combatant who is able to defeat rivals
= synonyms: superior
verb
- have a firm understanding or knowledge of
= synonyms: control
- be or become completely proficient or skilled in
= example: be or become completely proficient or skilled in
= synonyms: get the hang
- get on top of
= synonyms: subdue, get over, overcome, surmount
- have dominance or the power to defeat over
= example: have dominance or the power to defeat over
= synonyms: dominate
